Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2018 03:10PM gkhtoys wrote: Yes, go see a doctor and explain the events. You should be able to solve this with a few tests and it will give you peace of mind. Hang in there and please let us know what happens.
Posts.Title: Painful breast but not sure if it’s a problem or not MegMillyMo MegMillyMo

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2014 06:24PM gkhtoys wrote: The same thing happened to me on a mammogram and ultrasound.  I ended up having to have a core needle biopsy a week later that revealed a small benign mass just under the nipple in an enlarged milk duct.  If they do suggest a core biopsy please don't be nervous...mine went so smoothly-I didn't even feel a thing!  I too was given a week of antibiotics but, it didn't cease the nipple leakage so I went to a surgeon today and they are taking the mass in the milk duct out in less than 2 weeks.  I am NOT a medical professional but, I do have a very similar case and I'm at ease with everything.  The original biopsy did not include the mass-just part of the duct so it was benign and I expect the mass to be the same.  This can be a terrifying process so I suggest you take a spouse or best friend with you to your appointments so they can hear what the Dr. says.  I will pray for you!
Posts.Title: Dark spot on ultrasound under nipple lovinthesun gkhtoys

Posts.Content: gkhtoys wrote: Hi,      I'm a 49 year old Mom of one fine son (age 21) and tomorrow I have a lumpectomy for my small tumor in the milk duct.  Any advice for someone who's gone through this before?  At age 21 I had a major breast reduction (going from a DD to a large B Size).  In Jan. 2014 I started having yellow discharge from my breast and since I couldn't breast feed 21 years ago-I freaked out a little bit.  I had a diagnostic mammo and ultrasound on Jan. 31st, then core biopsy on Feb. 10th.  They found a small tumor in one of my milk ducts and they want to remove that duct tomorrow with a wire lead.  The original biopsy said the duct was benign but, they didn't test the tumor...  Will the tumor also be benign because it hasn't infected the duct?  Any experience with this wire lead surgery? UPDATE:  I came through the breast surgery pretty well but, I had breathing and lung complications.  They kept me overnight and I just got home a couple of hours ago.  The wire insertion was a piece of cake, IV went in smoothly but, the anesthesia was a different story.  I had low oxygen levels, light-headed and had a severe headache with the surgery.  I will hear the biopsy results in 1 week and 2 weeks will be the Dr. follow up.  Thanks for all of your helpful comments! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2014 08:29AM gkhtoys wrote: Thanks for your helpful advice everyone!  One more question though...do they numb the spot where they are placing the wire through?  I hate needles so that's why I asked!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy tomorrow! Any advice? gkhtoys Moderators

Posts.Content: gkhtoys wrote: I'm a 49 year old Mom of 1 son (he's 21 years old now) and I initially went to the Dr. for nipple leakage...I was sent for a Diagnostic Mammogram with Ultrasound where they found a small mass in my milk duct.  Core Biopsy a week later revealed it was benign but, the Breast Specialist recommended an appointment with a Surgeon to have the duct removed.  This 30 minute outpatient surgery will be on March 27th at a hospital 1.5 hours away.  My question is...have you ever been told that a problem was benign and then it turned out to be more serious?  Any of you experienced a duct removal?  Should I get the pain meds filled afterwards?  Any advice would be greatly appreciated. Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2014 07:09AM gkhtoys wrote: I just had an excisional biopsy and the surgery went well-I just received the news that mine was benign!  Hang in there!  We're rooting for you!
